translation.title: The Simile of the Tree Trunk (2nd)

previous.name: The Simile of the Tree Trunk (1st)

segments.en: 242. The Simile of the Tree Trunk (2nd)

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kimilāyaṃ viharati gaṅgāya nadiyā tīre.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kimibilā on the bank of the Ganges river.

segments.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā mahantaṃ dārukkhandhaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā sotena vuyhamānaṃ.
segments.en: Seeing a large tree trunk being carried along by the current,

segments.pli: “passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, amuṃ mahantaṃ dārukkhandhaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā sotena vuyhamānan”ti?
segments.en: “Mendicants, do you see that large tree trunk being carried along by the current of the Ganges river?”

segments.pli: evaṃ vutte, āyasmā kimilo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When this was said, Venerable Kimbila said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “kiṃ nu kho, bhante, orimaṃ tīraṃ … pe …
segments.en: “But sir, what’s the near shore and what’s the far shore? What’s sinking in the middle? What’s getting stranded on high ground? What’s getting taken by humans or non-humans? What’s getting caught up in a whirlpool? And what’s rotting away?” …

segments.pli: Idha, kimila, bhikkhu aññataraṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti yathārūpāya āpattiyā na vuṭṭhānaṃ paññāyati.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant has committed the kind of corrupt offense from which there is no rehabilitation.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kimibilā…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha gives a parable of a large log floating downstream, which, if it steers clear of the many obstacles, will eventually reach the ocean. Venerable Kimbila asks for an explanation, and the Buddha clarifies each item.
